attributes.action: Bring back the DEATH penalty for PAEDOPHILES.
attributes.background: Shield Appeal is a campaign to protect the babies and children of our country . We all want the death penalty for PAEDOPHILES.
attributes.additional_details: We can't continue to allow the babies of our country to be raped and abused by these beasts . They all need to die . No more prison, no more costing the tax payers millions of pounds . Hang them .

attributes.action: Increase SMP to be paid for at least 1 year on a % of 90-95
attributes.background:
The miraculous bond between a mother and baby is so essential for the baby’s development in their first years. However current SMP is paid for a short period and not enough in percentage.
Increasing the SMP rate and duration will help mothers to take care of their babies for a longer duration.
attributes.additional_details:
Currently the SMP is paid as below in some European Countries:
Denmark:
Length Of Maternity Leave: 52 Weeks
Percentage Of Wages Paid: 100
Serbia:
Length Of Maternity Leave: 52 Weeks
Percentage Of Wages Paid: 100
Sweden: 
Length Of Maternity Leave: 420 Days
Percentage Of Wages Paid: 80
Norway:
Length Of Maternity Leave: 36 to 46 Weeks
Percentage Of Wages Paid: Parental benefits paid at 100 per cent for the shorter duration of leave and 80 per cent for the longer option.

attributes.action: Offer a unilateral guarantee of the rights of EU citizens in the UK post Brexit
attributes.background: More than 900,000 EU citizens are resident in the UK; making a positive contribution to our dynamic, multi-cultural society.  Offering a unilateral guarantee of their rights, without waiting for a reciprocal guarantee will demonstrate to our EU partners our good faith in Brexit negotiations.
attributes.additional_details:
No human being deserves to be used a pawn in negotiations between nations.  We have the opportunity to set a positive tone as we engage in Brexit negotiations.  No one seriously believes that a reciprocal offer will not be made; but it's hard for the EU to move fast. 

The UK doesn't have to wait.  These people are our friends, neighbours, colleagues and lovers.  Let's make it clear the kind of nation that we want to be.

attributes.action: Make it illegal to offer social media accounts to children under 16
attributes.background: Social media is wrecking  young lives,  if it's not bullying  which branches out way past their own school,  its isolating  and excluding kids who see the 'fun' they haven't  been asked to join, choices are made of what to post on a whim and then regretted. It is available 24/7 with no escape.
attributes.additional_details:
Children's mental health services are struggling to cope with referrals they are receiving,  this is a ticking time bomb for young people.
A campaign by the NSPCC  Share Aware gives advice  how to keep your child safe online,  most worrying however is the anxiety, depression and in some cases suicide in under 16's caused by social media. These sites can be accessed easily with fabricated dates of birth.

attributes.action: Grant children immediate access to life saving drug.
attributes.background:
NHS England have today announced that all early access programmes regarding Nusinersen will be put on hold. They want to open just 5 centres accross the country, this takes time. Time is something many SMA children don't have. 
Please join me in asking NHS England to reverse this decision.
attributes.additional_details:
Nusinersen is the only known treatment of SMA, it is not a miracle cure, however it gives children time and a better quality of life. 
Spinal Muscular Atrophy, what's that you might ask. A month ago I wouldn't have known my self. 
It's an evil disease that effectively makes your child waste away. Their muscles waste until eventually they suffer respiratory failure, the whole time their brain unaffected.

attributes.action: Make Asthma Treatment FREE For Asthma Sufferers
attributes.background: I am a life long Asthma Sufferer. I was born with the conditions and throughout my life, I have always wondered why other conditions such as Diabetes and Epilepsy get free medication?
attributes.additional_details:
I am most worried about the 250,000 with severe (uncontrollable) asthma. It's thought they make up more than half of asthma deaths. Costs of their treatments can be considerable - they often need powerful steroid tablets and antibiotics.

Emergency hospital admissions for adults are estimated to cost the NHS £61 million a year and many relate to poor asthma control. 

Better access to medicines keeps people healthy, out of hospital and working. 

Those who manage the budget always look to save money, but charging asthma patients for prescriptions is a back-to-front and morally questionable way to do it.

attributes.action: Form a British Expat Committee to defend Expats rights in pre-Brexit negotiation
attributes.background: This Committee is to consist of representatives from Spain, Ireland, Germany, France and Italy to cover the diverse social demographics of the 5 main countries.  It will contend issues raised during the Brexit debate prior to negotiations which adversely affect the rights and welfare of Expats.
attributes.additional_details: Of critical importance is that Government decisions concerning Expats be negotiated with Brussels after having consulted with the committee.  Currently the anxieties and opinions of ordinary Expats are not being sought on issues directly affecting them and their futures.  Government decision-makers will not be affected by outcomes which have an impact on Expats’ rights, healthcare and the benefits they enjoy.  The futures of Expats must not be regarded as bargaining chips.

attributes.action: Introduce meat and dairy taxes to correct market failure in the food industry
attributes.background: Food production causes a quarter of all greenhouse gas emissions that are driving global warming. Both the UN International Research Panel and the Oxford University Martin Programme have suggested pricing in the environmental impacts of meat and dairy are vital steps to combating climate change.
attributes.additional_details:
The Oxford report states average surcharges of 40% on beef and 20% on milk would account for the damage they cause people via climate change and Maarten Hajer, the lead author of the UN report has recommended similar action. We hereby call on the government to implement such taxes to help meet our international obligations to combat climate change. 

http://www.nature.com/nclimate/journal/vaop/ncurrent/pdf/nclimate3155.pdf
https://www.dropbox.com/sh/bhhivquadq7ycnd/AAAIl8mVW9GCiOyGwk71At_ra?dl=0

attributes.action: Update Housing Association tenants on the right to buy. We voted in good faith!
attributes.background: Give HA tenants some information and a timeline regarding right to buy extension. There have been no updates on the pilot scheme and there has now been talk of the right to buy extension not being completed till 2020 this is a totally unacceptable timeline.

attributes.action: Tougher sentencing for One Punch Killers
attributes.background: The average sentence in the U.K. for a One Punch Killing is a pitiful 3 years! There have even been cases in which the perpetrator has had no sentence imposed at all! When the family of the victim have a life sentence of loss and no justice, how is that right?!?

attributes.action: Increase minimum wage for 18+ year olds to the same as the national living wage
attributes.background:
At the age of 18 you have to pay ADULT prices, if we are having to pay adult prices we should be paid the same! Additionally if we are doing the SAME job as someone 25 we should get the SAME pay! 

Some 18-24 year olds have families etc with bills and rent to pay the same as 25+ year olds!

attributes.action: Help create an international fund to counteract the U.S. 'global gag rule'.
attributes.background: The new U.S. President has reinstated legislation which threatens U.S.-funded aid organisations with withdrawal of funding should they offer women abortions or advocate abortion rights. The right to bodily autonomy is a fundamental human right and we must not allow it to be threatened.
attributes.additional_details: Marie Stopes International estimates that the loss of their services alone could lead to 6.5m unintended pregnancies, 2.1m unsafe abortions, and 21,700 maternal deaths. We call upon HM Government to increase its foreign health aid commitments and help mitigate the devastating impact of this legislation. The Dutch government has already launched plans for an international fund and we ask that the U.K. to contribute to this effort, and so help defend the rights of millions of vulnerable women.

attributes.action: Prevent leaders of countries that ban entry of Israelis/Jews from coming to UK
attributes.background: Leaders of countries that ban the entry of Israelis or Jews should be allowed to enter the UK in their capacity as head of their Government, but should not be invited to make an official State Visit because it would cause embarrassment to Her Majesty the Queen.
attributes.additional_details:
You will be shocked that in the 21st century there are countries which ban entry to their borders based on religion!

Countries (including airlines) which ban Israelis/Jews from entering their borders include:  Algeria,Bangladesh,Brunei,Iran,Iraq,Kuwait, Lebanon,Libya,Malaysia,Oman,Pakistan,Saudi Arabia,Sudan,Syria, United Arab Emirates,Yemen

They are however free to enter Israel! 

The government should also pressurize these countries to reverse this disgraceful policies.

attributes.action: Stop the concentration of Heathrow's Flight Paths.
attributes.background: The Department of Transport have made the Heathrow' flight paths concentrated. Meaning some people will be getting all the noise from aircraft coming in and out of Heathrow. There should be a fairer system.
attributes.additional_details:
Concentrated flight paths are very bad for people's physical and mental health. Some people will have rented or brought their homes in peaceful locations but are now finding there is a concentrated flight path over their heads. 

Unwanted noise increases stress levels in the body, that can cause sleep disturbance and even cause issues like heart disease. Known mental health issues through unwanted loud continued noise are starting to becoming more common due to these concentrated flight paths.

attributes.action: Solar PV on all new buildings.
attributes.background:
More than 3,000,000 people worldwide have died from climate change, not to mention the damage to other species.

It's possible to provide the UK's electrical needs with rooftop Solar PV & storage. Forcing developers to install at new build will be a big step to reducing CO2e emissions.
attributes.additional_details:
World Health Organisation website states that 150,000 people a year were dying from climate change related issues in 2000 and this will increase to 250,000 people a year by 2030. 
http://www.who.int/mediacentre/factsheets/fs266/en/ 
Cornwall Solar Panels website shows how much Solar PV is needed to power the UK. 
http://www.cornwallsolarpanels.co.uk/news/power-to-the-people-the-no-bills-uk-energy-revolution/

attributes.action: To keep the Four Freedoms as defined by membership of the EEA even after Brexit.
attributes.background: All those who voted Remain and many who voted Leave are in favour of the Four Freedoms and accept that this includes Free Movement of People. These voters are the true majority. Restricting European migration was NOT an option on the ballot paper and should not, therefore, be a Brexit "deal breaker"
attributes.additional_details: For example, many small businesses voted Leave in protest of excessive EU regulations. Many more individuals voted Leave because they believed it would help fund the NHS. Plenty voted Leave to give the UK sovereignty over its own Laws. Others voted in protest of the Tory policy of austerity. Only a MINORITY of the voters voted Leave to control migration. The Government should, therefore, keep the Four Freedoms in the Brexit negotiations as is the wish of the voting majority.

attributes.action: To grant Reading (Berkshire) city status as a key hub in Thames Valley
attributes.background: Reading (Berkshire) has a population of 232,000 and is a key hub for the Thames Valley region.  Its importance should be recognised and given city status.  We the people of Reading are now asking the Lord Chancellor to recommend to the Monarch, the granting of city status to Reading.
attributes.additional_details:
Reading is a Vibrant City that contributes significantly to our economy and culture.  It is one of the largest towns worthy of City status.

The town applied in 2012 and was disappointed after a long application process.  It was not selected as one of the three cities chosen but we strongly believe that it should be chosen.

attributes.action: Reclassify Dangerous Dogs Act to reflect exhibited behaviour instead of breed
attributes.background:
Many harmless dogs are seized simply based on how they look; it will most likely be destroyed or at least lose all quality of life
Saying dogs who look a certain way are dangerous would be like saying a person who shares similar physical features to Jimmy Savile  are a danger to children
attributes.additional_details:
About the Act:
http://researchbriefings.files.parliament.uk/documents/SN04348/SN04348.pdf

History of the Act:
http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-politics-18114406

The Independent: Dog Breeds Most Likely To Attack (most aren't on the list of banned breeds)
http://www.independent.co.uk/news/uk/home-news/dog-breed-most-likely-to-attack-bite-you-revealed-a7166296.html

Dangerous Dogs Act 1991 Legislation:
http://www.legislation.gov.uk/ukpga/1991/65/contents

attributes.action: Help ensure Volkswagen service action is not damaging vehicles
attributes.background: Volkswagen (VAG) mislead regulators and customers regarding the cheat device. There is now anecdotal evidence that the fix offered is causing damage to vehicles: http://uk.reuters.com/article/us-volkswagen-emissions-idUKKCN12S13Y
attributes.additional_details: The UK Government should work with the German Government and other EU partners to do all it can to ensure that the fix, which was approved by the KBA (German type approval authority), is not damaging vehicles and provide assurance to UK customers. The UK Government should also publish the information it has on the outcome of any tests on the VW fix.

attributes.action: Impose Levy for Football clubs in the Premier/Football League for Play Areas
attributes.background:
Recent discussion about Local Authorities trying to maintain Play Areas and their possibly being forced to cut funding.
The huge sums of money available to these professional football clubs should ensure that our young people are given good places to play and keep fit.
attributes.additional_details: Recent reports in the media which imply Local Authorities may have to cut back on Play facilities.

attributes.action: End the Detention of vulnerable Refugee Children
attributes.background:
The #canyouhearme project wishes to protect vulnerable refugee children from being held in unsuitable detention facilities that do not safeguard their wellbeing.

We call the Government to account for their promises to better safeguard and end the detention of innocent children.
attributes.additional_details:
The Trump American Refugee Ban has caused outrage around the globe. We as UK citizens want to show an act of solidarity against the treatment of young child refugees being detained, who merely seek sanctuary after escaping terrible and unimaginable terror.

Help their voices be heard.

attributes.action: Stop the closing of emergency mental health services (Weller Wing) in Bedford.
attributes.background: Weller Wing (Mental health ward) has been deemed "not fit for purpose". The 17 in-patients have been transferred to Houghten Regis, and the ward will be completely closed to out-patients too by March, with no time frame or budget for the services return.
attributes.additional_details: Weller Wing is not fit for purpose, so fix it, don't get rid of the only emergency mental health service we have. 1 in 4 people suffer with mental health problems, that's around 19,700 people in Bedford who would benefit from this service. All we have now is a promise that it will return, but there's currently no time frame or budget for that. It is negligent to just bin the service with no future plans, as opposed to fixing the service.

attributes.action: UK Citizens under the age of 40 should receive 3 cycles on the NHS for free.
attributes.background: In some areas of the UK you only get 1 try on the NHS for IVF. this can be a stressful undertaking so there should be a fair balance across the country to help all people start a family.

attributes.action: Introduce legislation to make all strike action on the railways illegal.
attributes.background: The ongoing strike action by Southern Rail staff has caused misery for hundreds of thousands of commuters, in some cases leading to people losing their jobs. In 21st Century Britain this should not be allowed.  The rest of us have to go to work every day - why should they hold the UK to ransom?
attributes.additional_details: I take Southern trains back from work every day.  They have been either late or cancelled about 95% of the time over the last year.

attributes.action: Government to invest 2p per litre of fuel duty to fix potholes on local roads.
attributes.background: Decades of under investment in local road maintenance has resulted in a maintenance bill of £12 billion yet the problem is getting worse as highway authorities reduce their maintenance spend each year. Investing 2p per litre of fuel duty would make an extra £1Bn available each year to resolve this.

attributes.action: People with permanent disabilities can apply for disability benefits immediately
attributes.background: Disabled benefits like PIP (formerly DLA), the Personal Independence Payment, make people wait 3 months before they can apply. Many other forms of help such as blue badges also require PIP as a form of proof of disability. Disabilities such as the loss of a limb should be allowed PIP immediately.
attributes.additional_details:
About PIP
https://www.gov.uk/pip/eligibility

attributes.action: Establish Fibromyalgia clinics  to improve services for chronic pain in the Uk.
attributes.background: Fibromylgia is a chronic. syndrome affecting 1 in 20 of the population. Although it can be diagnosed easily by Rheumotologists,  GP's in local surgeries are often unable to make a diagnosis, or provide the level of medical care and support which is necessary .
attributes.additional_details:
Fibromyalgia is identified by pain in all 4 quadrants of the body, chronic fatigue and sleeping disorders. It is a complex condition involving many other symptoms from Irritable Bowel Syndrome, cognitive impairment, poor and poor co ordination to severe headaches ,Temporal Mandible Joint pain , and many others.
Providing clinics which run in a similar manner to diabetic clinics, would provide a higher standard of support for Fibromyalgia patients.These clinics are being trialled in some parts of the UK reducing trips to A and E departments,  clinic waiting times and the number of visits to a variety of other clinics.

attributes.action: Give teachers the choice to retire at 55 with full retirement benefits.
attributes.background: Teachers can retire at the age of 55 but with reduced retirement benefits. The government should give teachers the choice to retire at the age of 55 with full retirement benefits (worked out by the number of years an individual has paid into their pension).
attributes.additional_details:
More teachers would choose to retire early and therefore could be replaced with newly qualified teachers. The benefits would be:
* Mature teachers who wish to retire early could do so without worrying about financial barriers.
* The teaching profession will be more appealing.
* If the teachers were to be replaced by newly qualified teachers, it would cost less.
* Happier schools with enthusiastic teachers who actually want to be there instead of having teachers who have no choice but to be there just because they can't afford to retire on the small fraction currently offered

attributes.action: Make the PassivHaus standard mandatory for new buildings in the UK
attributes.background: The PassivHaus standard delivers buildings that are healthy, comfortable, and cheap to heat, with heating bills and resulting carbon emissions less than 10% of the average UK building stock. Fuel poverty and climate change can be delivered through high levels of internal comfort.
attributes.additional_details:
Despite the obvious benefits of the standard, the construction industry often requires more stick than carrot, with full take-up of the standard only happening in places where legislation has been brought about, such as Brussels, Frankfurt and Dún Laoghaire.

While the Building Regs are based on the minimum acceptable standard the building industry will deliver buildings of low performance, with high energy wastage, poor comfort conditions and contradicting design and living practices.

attributes.action: Amend Housing Act 1988 to stop care home owners banning restricting and evicting
attributes.background: Your Voice Matters was set up after I was unfairly banned from a care home http://www.yourvoicematters.org.uk/rights2speakup4care  Providers possess the powers of a landlord. They can ban, restrict loved ones (or any professional) and evict residents; PRIVATE paying residents have no protection.
attributes.additional_details: The Care Act 2014 alleges residents fully or partially funded and placed by L.A.'s are protected under the Human Rights Act 1998, unlike self-funders. CQC guidelines (2/11/16) purport that residents are protected under Article 8 BUT the Housing Act 1988 provides ultimate powers for providers to ban, restrict and evict; some instigate malicious falsehood and staff will support as fearful of reprisals. For this reason The Housing Act 1988 needs amending. www.yourvoicematters.org.uk
attributes.creator_name: Jenny Moore - Your Voice Matters CIC

attributes.action: Stop MPs banning the RSPCA from prosecuting those who are cruel to animals.
attributes.background: A group of MPs are trying to stop the RSPCA from prosecuting those who starve, beat, stab, burn and abuse poor defensless animals.
attributes.additional_details: The RSPCA is paid for by public donations (animal lovers) and not through taxes therefore has nothing to do with MP's. With over 200 years of experience the RSPCA does a fantastic job at protecting the welfare of animals including prosecuting those who are cruel to them. Don't let MP's take this power away so that animals become a lesser priority. Who else do they have?

attributes.action: Make 'puppy farm' licensing stringently regulated in the U.K. to avoid suffering
attributes.background: Some of the licensed farms hold >100 breeding bitches caged in less than 1 cubic meter, no daylight, nowhere to toilet having litter after litter, true breeding machines! Puppies are taken away too early adding more cruelty to these dogs' life making life unbearable for these intelligent animals
attributes.additional_details:
Regulate conditions for breeding dogs on licensed puppy farms. Breeding dogs have less protected rights than battery farm chickens and are scrupulously used as money makers by licensed farms. Some 'breeders' don't even bother to kill the bitches once they have had too many litters, they are just left to starve.
Regulate number of breeding bitches per licensed establishment, all to be kept in approved sized kennels with daylight and daily outdoor runs & regulate the number of litters per bitch

attributes.action: Ban Zero-Hour Contract
attributes.background: Zero-hour contracts are making life harder for everyone facing it. The employee does not have any guaranteed working hours. This, in its turn, leads to the risk of being homeless and poor. A lot of people are struggling to get a property to live because nobody wants to deal with 0-hour workers.
attributes.additional_details:
People are also struggling to feed their family while, in fact, they work hard to survive. I am asking to ban Zero-hour contracts and follow the example of countries, like New Zeland. Every hard-working person should have the same working rights and be able to rent a property, apply for mortgage and a lot more.
 
Please sign this petition to help make people's life a little bit better.

Thank you for your time!

attributes.action: Create a bottle deposit scheme for the UK similar to those used in Scandinavia.
attributes.background: The deposit return scheme sees a small deposit (approx. 10p) added to the cost of a drinks container which is refunded when the container is recycled. The impacts in terms of energy costs and CO2 emissions can be considerable. The scheme also helps to reduce littering and it's environmental impacts.
attributes.additional_details: Sweden offers a world-leading example of how to deal with waste from drinks bottles and cans.  The scheme has resulted in recycling rates of more than 90 per cent of its drinks containers. Recycling glass can save 80 per cent of raw materials mined and, with recycled aluminium saving 95 per cent of the energy it takes to make new aluminium. The success of the 5 pence levy on single-use plastic bags proves that these kinds of policies can work well in the UK.

attributes.action: Offer free 20 hours of childcare to all families, with children age 1 year plus.
attributes.background: There is a significant gap in the provision of childcare. Parents/carers are encouraged to return to work after averagely taking a year off after having a baby. But when working, they have little disposable income because it mainly goes on childcare.
attributes.additional_details: The Joseph's roundtree foundation has recently published findings which included: that 60% of in-work families are currently in poverty. Many social issues would be resolved if there were less financial and emotional strain on families. This type of policy would efficiently use all the talent lost when people start a family. It makes sense in these uncertain and difficult economic times. Let's make a difference to our future generations lives!

attributes.action: Set a minimum salary of £25,000 per year for care workers working in care homes.
attributes.background: Social care currently lacks resource. Many care homes pay near to the minimum wage and many only offer permanent contracts of up to 30 hours a week. The industry needs change, it needs improvement. Better pay will attract people with talent and skills delivering a higher quality of care.
attributes.additional_details:
A 30 hour contract on minimum wage pays a carer over 25 years old, £864 gross a month. Nowadays that just about pays for the average rent of a family home without any other associated costs.

Benefits:

Improve employee satisfaction.

Gross costs directly returned to the public purse via income tax and NI.

Wage rise would amount to further savings on tax credits & other in work benefits.

Improve staff retention rates.

Save on recruitment costs.

Investment for long term stability.

attributes.action: Introduce Safety Standards for Pet Food, Treats and Toys
attributes.background: Cooked bones and rawhide chews aimed at dogs are a serious choking risk and can cause intestinal problems and even death yet these are still sold in many pet shops and major retailers so people think they are safe. Please ban cooked bones, rawhide chews and any pet treats and toys containing toxins.
attributes.additional_details:
http://healthypets.mercola.com/sites/healthypets/archive/2010/05/19/caution-bones-can-kill-your-dog-find-out-which-ones-are-safe.aspx

http://pets.webmd.com/rawhide-good-or-bad-for-your-dog

attributes.action: Parliamentary review of speed limits for vans under 3.5 tons on UK roads
attributes.background:
It has been a long standing issue that vans are expected to do less speed on dual (60mph) and single carriageways (50mph).
These rulings were brought about when vehicles weren't made to the standard they are now and require updating to meet current vehicle design criteria.

attributes.action: Childcare Element of Tax Credits, paid directly to Childcare providers.
attributes.background: As a group of Childminders we have all, at some point, experienced not being paid by parents/carers of the children we look after for childcare we have provided. Most of the parents/carers we work with receive the childcare element of Tax Credits, yet still fail to make payment.

attributes.action: UK Government ask Government of USA to pay security costs of Trump state visit
attributes.background: Despite over 1.8 million signing e petition and President Trump being prevented from speaking in Parliament, Prime Minister is refusing to call off state visit. Taking this into account hundreds of thousands are expected to join protests against visit pushing security costs to well over £15 million
attributes.additional_details:
The state visit is not justified at this stage of the Trump Presidency 

It will cause embarrassment to the Queen and cause huge protests at massive cost to the tax payer 

Presidents Reagan, George H W Bush & Clinton never had a state visit to UK throughout their terms of office 

President George W Bush & Obama only had a state visit after 3 years into their Presidency 

If the state visit goes ahead against will of millions of British people the US Government should pay all security costs

attributes.action: Form all party commission into social care provision
attributes.background:
We ALL know social care is in crisis. We need a 'joined-up' approach to social care and health that is 
- realistic about both need and cost
- reduces the party political blame game
- thinks long-term
- recognises the urgency for radical reform

attributes.action: Ringfence Science & Research Funding After Brexit.
attributes.background: For centuries the UK has been a driving force in terms of Science and innovation and we believe that it would be best for us all if we guarantee jobs and funding for our science sector.
attributes.additional_details:
We believe that it is essential that any money being lost from UK Science should be guaranteed by the government. 

We also believe that the UK should continue to contribute to international collaberations such as the European Space Agency and CERN.

We believe that education should be available to all at a cost that will not cause financial difficulties.

attributes.action: Keep our community hospital open
attributes.background: We desperately need this hospital in a town the size of Saltash . The poor transport links to Derriford and Liskeard will be a huge problem to those who need minor injury treatment .

attributes.action: Abolish Bedroom Tax on all Council Properties
attributes.background: This Bedroom Tax is affecting thousands of families all across the UK, when it was originally imposed there was a lot of debate to abolish it and yet this has not been done.
attributes.additional_details:
This affects everyone living in social housing; disabled, welfare recipients, and those who work. If you live in a council property and have any spare bedrooms, you will be forced to pay the tax whatever your personal situation may be; even if you have lived in that property for up to 22 years. 

The government has decided that:

* Any single person aged 16 or over needs their own bedroom.
* A couple need a bedroom.
* A child needs a bedroom BUT.....
* A boy and a girl are expected to share a bedroom if they are both under 10.
* 2 boys or 2 girls are expected to share if they are both under 16. See below for examples.
* Foster children are not taken into account 
* Children who stay with you part of the time aren’t taken into account.

attributes.action: Public enquiry over the last decade regarding social service/cafcass failings
attributes.background:
The failings of both social services/cafcass
And reluctance to follow up on detrimental information their reluctance to participate this alienated parents and their dismissal of information
attributes.additional_details: Information can be supplied by various groups

attributes.action: More democracy at work: let workers elect representatives to company boards
attributes.background:
The Prime Minister announced her support for a change in company law to allow workers to elect representatives to sit on company boards.

But this welcome proposal for corporate governance reform has been watered down. 

This is unacceptable - democratic representation should not be voluntary.
attributes.additional_details:
“If I’m prime minister ... we’re going to have not just consumers represented on 
company boards, but workers as well.”  - Theresa May, 11th July 2016

Worker representation is not a replacement for existing agreements between companies and trade unions. Nor is it a means of reducing the independence unions.

The TUC has published a report on how the policy could be implemented: https://www.tuc.org.uk/economic-issues/corporate-governance/workplace-issues/all-aboard-making-worker-representation

attributes.action: Emotional Assistance Pet Act Urgently Needed.
attributes.background:
To grant the right for people in rented accommodation, who are struggling with emotional distress, depression - to keep a pet regardless of any “No Pet Clause”.

[According to Mental Health Foundation research, major depression is thought to be the second leading cause of disability worldwide.]
attributes.additional_details: The highest rates of suicides are associated with depressive disorder. More than, 6,00 suicides occur in the UK and Ireland each year. Due to the housing crisis we become "generation rent". The Mental Health Foundation research confirms value of "pet therapy" in suicide prevention and treating depression leading to it. It is scientifically confirmed that human-animal emotional bonds are equal to mother-child one, that no one would dare to question.

attributes.action: Abolish the Human Rights Act.
attributes.background: We believe that the Human Rights Act should be abolished.  For too long, it has been used as a criminals charter to escape justice and deportation by using the right to family life.  It is high time the Government acted and abolished this pernicious Act.

attributes.action: Make it illegal for event tickets to be sold at more than Face Value.
attributes.background: Over the past 15 - 20 years it has become almost impossible to buy an event ticket for Face Value, companies like Ticketmaster etc are ticket touts of the worse kind. Not only do they increase the cost of the ticket they also add extra's e.g. handling fee, transaction costs, delivery.
attributes.additional_details:
Recent example: GetMeIn a Ticketmaster company: 2 x £55 Robbie Williams Tickets. £97.90 each, plus £35.88 transaction fee. Total for two tickets £231.68 
THIS IS DAYLIGHT ROBBERY & SHOULD BE ILLEGAL
Surely the venue has agreed on the original ticket price and this price has been set to cover all costs and overheads, therefore who, in this particular case benefits from the extra £121.68
Sporting Events:  VIVAGO ar offering Six Nations Tickets for Wales v England £75 tickets for £190 each

attributes.action: Add gender-neutral name fields to the marriage certificate
attributes.background: This petition proposes that two gender-neutral name fields be added to  the marriage certificate, to replace the father-only field. This suggestion is to enable parity, irrespective of gender/sexual orientation.
attributes.additional_details: In answer to the previous petition that the mother's name be added to the marriage certificate, alongside the father's [https://www.change.org/p/mothers-names-should-be-on-marriage-certificates], the Home Office decided that it cannot agree to adding the mother's name, as that assumes couples have opposite-gender parents, and the idea is therefore exclusionary. Gender-neutral name fields is the obvious solution to this problem.
